title: Lenny Kravitz announces Australian and New Zealand tour
text:
He is often described as one of the last remaining rock stars.

And on Wednesday, Lenny Kravitz announced he will tour Australia and New Zealand for the first time in eight years.

The 55-year-old musician will perform in Auckland on March 31, before heading to Sydney and embarking on a string of concerts.

It Ain't Over 'til It's Over! On Wednesday, Lenny Kravitz (pictured) announced that he will tour Australia and New Zealand for the first time in eight years

The American Woman star will play Qudos Bank Arena in Sydney on April 3, before travelling to Newcastle on April 6 and Melbourne on April 8.

Lenny, who is known for his impressive stage shows, has promised to live up to his reputation as an electrifying performer.

During his visit to Australia, he will also headline the Byron Bay Bluesfest, alongside the likes of Patti Smith and Crowded House.

Get excited! The 55-year-old musician will perform in Auckland, New Zealand on March 31, before heading to Sydney and embarking on a string of Australian concerts

Lenny Kravitz's tour dates Tickets go on sale 11am on Thursday, 24 October March 31: Spark Arena, Auckland

April 3: Qudos Bank Arena, Sydney

April 6: Newcastle Entertainment Centre, Newcastle

April 8: Rod Laver Arena, Melbourne

April 10: Bluesfest, Byron Bay

The upcoming tour marks Lenny's first visit to Australia in eight years, after he pulled out of Bluesfest in 2015 due to 'scheduling conflicts'.

He said of his connection to the NSW town, saying: 'I love it there, I'm going other places but obviously Byron is very special to me and has been since my first trip there, I love it so much.'

Tickets go on sale to the general public on October, 24 via Ticketmaster
description: He is often described as one of the last remaining rock stars.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
